sentences: Harold Hopkins Miranda (born 1971 in San Juan, Puerto Rico is a Puerto Rican bass player, composer, director and founder of the rock fusion band Puya.
In 1990, he got together with high school friend Ramon Ortiz (guitar) and founded Whisker Biscuit (original Latin/rock/funk-fusion).
In 1992 The Evidence moved to Ft. Lauderdale and changed its name to Puya.
In 1993, the band recorded its first six-song cassette, Puya-Whisker Biscuit and then in 1994-95 released a CD titled Puya under Noiz Boiz Records and produced by Jeff Renza/Puya.
In May 1996 the band had its first overseas show in Bogota, Colombia at Rock Al Parque Festival.
In 1997 Hopkins Miranda moved with the band to Los Angeles, CA and played in clubs.
Fundamental won the Best Rock Fusion album of the year at the 2000 Billboard Latin Music Awards.
In 2001 Puya recorded a second album, Union (MCA) produced by Garth Richardson and Andrew Murdock and co-produced by Puya.
Puya took a break in 2004.
Yeva played Coachella Fest 2007, winning the best newcomer recognition according to the Chicago Tribune.
Puya made a comeback in 2009, playing many Puerto Rican festivals and headlining one stage at the Rock al Parque 2010 festival in Bogota, Colombia.

In 2011, Hopkins Miranda founded the rock/blues/bomba fusion band Tambores Calientes with Gilberto Alomar and Marcos Pe√±alosa.
In 2017 Harold joined Latin American metal supergroup De La Tierra to replace Sr.
In 1993, the band recorded its first six-song cassette, Puya-Whisker Biscuit and then in 1994-95 released a CD titled Puya under Noiz Boiz Records and produced by Jeff Renza/Puya.

After that he formed part of a trio, The Evidence, along with the Alomar brothers, Gilberto (guitar and main vocal) and Hugo (drums), playing rock from the 1960s and 1970s, some originals by Gilberto, and a lot of Jimi Hendrix.
He is currently the bass player for De La Tierra.
Fundamental won the Best Rock Fusion album of the year at the 2000 Billboard Latin Music Awards.
The success of Fundamental sent the band to the Ozzfest '99 tour.
That year Puya recorded a self-produced, five-song EP, Areyto.
